resource.name: sequenceInput.inputSequenceInFastaFormat
resource.p:
You may can either:
genotype sequences that you paste in FASTA format in the input field.
upload a FASTA file.
revisit results of a previous run
resource.h3: A) Paste nucleotide sequence(s) in FASTA format:

resource.name: sequenceInput.uploadSequenceInFastaFormat
resource.h3: B) Or, upload a FASTA with nucleotide sequences:

resource.name: startForm.monitorJob
resource.h3: C) Or, revisit results from a previous run:

resource.name: monitorForm.explain
resource.p: You may bookmark this page to revisit results of this job ({1}) later.

resource.name: monitorForm.analysisInProgress
resource.p:
Analysis in progress... (Showing partial results).
This page will be automatically updated every {1} seconds...

resource.name: defaultSequenceAssignment.referenceSequence
resource.p: Your sequence starts at position {1} and finishes at position {2} in the {3} genome.

common-settings.resource: This section contains the alignments, inferred phylogenetic trees, and detailed results of the evolutionary analysis.
This section contains the recombination plots, and data from which they were derived.
Bootscan analysis performed with window size {1} and step size {2}.
This section contains details of the phylogenetic signal analysis.
Recombination Analyses are only performed for sequences with more than 800 bp.
Alignments with phylogenetic signal higher than 0.9 are considered suitable for the REGA subtype analysis. View the quartets mapped to the triangle.
Recombination Analyses are only performed for sequences with more than 800 bp.
